instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3787: What is 820-3787? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00426: What is 820-00426? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT is a power rail that powers the LED light in the screen of the device that allows you to see what is on the screen. When this is low or missing, the screen will be dim..
definitions.LCD_PWR_EN: What is LCD_PWR_EN? LCD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip that supplies power to the LCD screen to turn on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No image on display
threads.message:
Have this board, no liquid damage or corrosion. Came in for no image on display, but when i first power it on, it worked just fine until I changed the energy saving setting to always use the AMD GPU and not the Intel. As soon as I made the change, and it switch to black screen. 
i was going to replace <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> but decided to replace <CHIP>U9300</CHIP> first which didn't fix it. 

My question, can i use a <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> chip from a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> or <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00426</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board or as an alternative, i can purchase this chip from DigiKey.com?
On the schematic, apple part numbers  341S3565 and 337S4313 match on both the 3332 and 3787. Plus the spec info from BOM page matches DigiKey.com.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No image on display
threads.message:
<CHIP>U9600</CHIP> has firmware, but I don't know untill which point is board dependant.
New chip probably will not serve...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No image on display
threads.message: So replaced <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> with one from the same board. Same outcome. I did noticed that  <SIGNAL>LCD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> is 0V, while <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL> is about 50v. Any suggestion?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No image on display
threads.message:
50V on backlight output means open LED strips.
Bad LCD connecotr, video cable, or display.
If you get that voltage, image should be there too.
Did you check external video?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No image on display
threads.message:
No video on external display or on another known good display.
Also fan ramps up to max. Ive tested with another frame to confirm issue isn't with keyboard or trackpad.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No image on display
threads.message:
Do you have USB activity at least?
Did you try PRAM reset?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No image on display
threads.message: Yes to both, along with SMC reset. I'm going to reseat <CHIP>U9600</CHIP> late today/tomorrow.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No image on display
threads.message: So before pulling <CHIP>U9600</CHIP>, since i still had the original one, i installed it into the donor board (which didn't originally have video issue) and the chip works. So now i'm lost again as to where to go from here

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3787</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>: No image on display
threads.message:
If problem appeared after set GPU as default, should be GPU issue.
USB activity also confirms board booting and only video is bad.
Good luck to find a good GPU...
